intro: Mallotus pierrei, commonly known as the Koa tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain a single seed. It is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it plays an important ecological role. Due to habitat loss, Mallotus pierrei is considered a vulnerable species.
